abstract: Federal prosecutors charge Alonzo Knowles with felony criminal copyright infringement and identity theft for his role in scheme in which he sought to sell information gathered from hacking celebrities' email accounts; Knowles had in his possession scripts for unreleased films and television shows as well as sex tapes and social security numbers for number of celebrities.
lead_paragraph: The charges against Alonzo Knowles illustrate the ease with which private email contacts, even for security-conscious entertainers, can be exploited.

headline.main: U.S. Says Hacker Stole IDs and Unreleased Scripts From Host of Celebrities
headline.print_headline: U.S. Says Hacker Stole IDs and Scripts From Celebrities

snippet: The charges against Alonzo Knowles illustrate the ease with which private email contacts, even for security-conscious entertainers, can be exploited.
